Obituaries - June 2011

June 1, 2011 - Obituaries from the News-Star, Monroe, Louisiana 71201

Dorothy LaRaye Bourgeois Funeral Services for Mrs. Dorothy LaRaye Bourgeois, 80, of West Monroe, LA will be 10:00 AM Thursday, June 2, 2011 in the chapel of Mulhearn Funeral Home, West Monroe with Rev. Terry Taylor and Rev. Michael Stravato officiating. Interment will follow at Roselawn Memorial Gardens Cemetery in Calhoun. Mrs. Bourgeois was a member of Family Church in West Monroe, where she enjoyed being a member of the Senior Small Group and retired from Anesthesia Associates. She attended Northeast Louisiana Junior College and was a member of the softball team. Mrs. Bourgeois was a devoted mother, grandmother, and friend. She is preceded in death by her husband, Mr. Nayton Bourgeois. Survivors include her sons, Terry M. Bourgeois and his wife, Sandra and Joe R. Bourgeois and his wife, Elisa; grandchildren, Erin Kirkland and her husband, Michael L. Kirkland, Jr., Emily Bourgeois, Chad Bourgeois, Shawna Jones and husband, Mark and Robert Smith, Jr. Pallbearers will be Michael L. Kirkland, Jr., Mark Jones, Mike Colvin, Chad Bourgeois, Ronnie Culp and James Tarkington. Honorary Pallbearer will be Billy Johnston. Visitation will be from 5:00 PM until 8:00 PM Wednesday, June 1, 2011 at Mulhearn Funeral Home, West Monroe. Online Registry/Condolences: www.mulhearnfuneralhome.com Mulhearn Funeral Home West Monroe, LA Published in The News Star on June 1, 2011

Wesley Daryl Hudgens Funeral services for Wesley Daryl Hudgens, 83, of Monroe, LA, will be held at 11:30 AM Thursday, June 2, 2011, in the chapel of Mulhearn Funeral Home, Sterlington Road, Monroe, with Rev. Mark Watson officiating. Interment will follow at Kilpatrick's Serenity Gardens. Mr. Hudgens passed away Tuesday, May 31, 2011, at St. Frances Medical Center. He studied computers in the early 1960's and developed a unique Clearing House System at Capitol Bank and Trust Co. In 1969, he installed a computer system in First National Bank in West Monroe. In later years, he went to work at First Nation Bank in West Monroe, in the First National Computer Center, which is now Financial Institution Service Corp. Mr. Hudgens was one of the original employees and also retired from FISC. He was a U. S. Navy veteran of WWII. Survivors include his wife of 55 years, Becki M. Hudgens of Monroe; children, Cynthia Hudgens of Salt Lake City, UT, Daryl Hudgens of Monroe, Eileen Dedmon and husband Darrell of Indianapolis, IN, and Brenda Fritz and husband John of Eros, LA; six grandchildren, four great grandchildren, two brothers, Dr. Edward Hudgens of Ohio and Jim Hudgens of Pensacola, FL; and numerous nieces and nephews. Pallbearers will be Will Brady, Shawn Brady, Daniel Tedeton, John Fritz, and Joe Brady. Visitation will be Wednesday, June 1, 2011, from 3:00 PM until 5:00 PM at Mulhearn Funeral Home, Sterlington Road, Monroe. Online Registry/Condolences: www.mulhearnfuneralhome.com Mulhearn Funeral Home Monroe, LA Published in The News Star on June 1, 2011

Jesse Raymond Simpson Funeral services for Jesse Raymond Simpson, 81, of Chatham, LA, will be held at 10:00 AM Thursday, June 2, 2011, at the Greater Apostolic Church, Chatham, LA. Rev. Doyle McManus, Bro. John Mitchell and Bro. Jesse Broughton will be officiating. Interment will follow at the church cemetery under the direction of Kilpatrick Funeral Home, West Monroe. Mr. Simpson was born November 20, 1929, and passed away May 30, 2011. Mr. Simpson was an FHA/VA contractor for about 40 years and attended the Greater Apostolic Church. He loved hunting, fishing and spending time with his family and his passion was music and playing musical instruments. He was preceded in death by his parents, Jesse D. Simpson and Eloise Hynum Simpson; 2 sisters, Carolyn Turnage and Jenny Lou Simpson. He is survived by his wife Twylia Simpson; daughters; Bonnie Broughton and Eloise Lowery and husband Ronald ; 5 step-children; John B. Mitchell and wife Jean, Judy Perrault and husband Robert, David Mitchell, Pam Ebey ,Alice Wiley and husband James; 2 brothers, Pete Simpson and James Simpson; 25 grandchildren, 54 great-grandchildren and 1 great-great grandchild. Pallbearers will be Tim Elliott, Jesse Broughton, Wes Broughton, Ryan Broughton, Jeremy Brown Deno Kokinos and Barret Brasseaux. Visitation will be held Wednesday, June 1, 2011, from 4:00 PM until 8:00 PM at Kilpatrick Funeral Home, West Monroe. Online condolences may be sent to the family at www.kilpatrickfuneralhomes.com Kilpatrick Funeral Home West Monroe, LA Published in The News Star on June 1, 2011

Evlon Cauthan "Meme" Stone Funeral Services for Evlon Cauthan "Meme" Stone, 91, of Monroe, LA, will be held 10:30 AM Wednesday, June 1, 2011, at Mulhearn Memorial Park Mausoleum Chapel, Monroe with Rev. Randy Impson officiating. Interment will follow at Mulhearn Memorial Park Cemetery, Monroe under the direction of Mulhearn Funeral Home. Mrs. Stone was born March 7, 1920, and passed away May 30, 2011. She was a longtime member of Emmanuel Baptist Church and Parkview Baptist Church, where she taught all ages of Sunday school. She lived a wonderful full life and everyone who knew her loved her. She is preceded in death by her husband, Floyd Edward Stone; son, Gerald Stone; daughter, Patricia Stone McNeely; and son-in-law, Larry McNeely. Mrs. Stone is survived by daughter-in law, Lavonne Stone; her grandchildren, Debora McNeely Colvin and husband, Todd, Michael Stone and wife, KC, Michelle Stone Anderson and husband, Ronald, Mark Stone and wife, Dina and Susan McNeely Love and husband, Lew; 11 Great Grandchildren and 5 Great Great Grandchildren; son, David Stone. Pallbearers will be Todd Colvin, Clay Colvin, Lew Love, Thomas Love, Ronald Anderson, Mark Stone, and Eric Bolton. Visitation will be held Wednesday, June 1, 2011, at 10:00 AM until service time at Mulhearn Memorial Park Mausoleum Chapel. Memorials may be made to the Baton Rouge Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation, 9457 Brookline Ave, Baton Rouge, LA 70809. Online Registry/Condolences: www.mulhearnfuneralhome.com Mulhearn Funeral Home West Monroe, LA Published in The News Star on June 1, 2011

Michael Anthony Tartt Mr. Michael Anthony Tartt, age 47, of Choudrant, LA, left this world to be with our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ on May 28, 2011. He was a good man with a really really big heart, a great husband and the best Dad in the world. We will truly miss you!! Please join us in celebrating his wonderful life that we had with him. Funeral services will be held Wednesday, June 1, 2011, at 2:00 PM at Owens Memorial Chapel. Following the ceremony, there will be a short graveside ceremony at Cartwright Baptist Church Cemetery in Cartwright, LA. Michael is survived by his wife Janet Tartt; children: Tiffany Tartt, Brianna Tartt & Davin Tartt; his father Doyle Tartt; mother Yvonne Brassfield; brothers Ricky Procella and Wayne Procella, and sister Sheila Tartt. Online condolences may be sent to www.owensmemorialfuneralhome.com Owens Memorial Chapel Ruston, LA Published in The News Star on June 1, 2011

June 2, 2010 - Obituaries from the News-Star, Monroe, Louisiana 71201

William "Randy" Beckham, Jr. Funeral services for William "Randy" Beckham, Jr., 41, of West Monroe will be held at 10:00 AM, Friday, June 3, 2011 in the chapel of Kilpatrick Funeral Home West Monroe. Rev. Greg Clark and Rev. Randy Burdeaux will be officiating. Interment will follow at Mt. Vernon Cemetery under the direction of Kilpatrick Funeral Home West Monroe. Randy was born December 15, 1969 in West Monroe and passed away May 31, 2011 in West Monroe. He was currently employed with Sysco Food Service. He worked for Marsala Beverage Company for 17 years. Randy graduated from Ouachita Parish High School and was a member of First Baptist Church Monroe. He was preceded in death by grandparents, Opal Jones, Bernard D. Beckham, Buddy and Ethel Coleman, Justin and Ruby McIver, Robert H. Crocker, Sr. and Minnie Lou Flurry; great-grandparents, Virgil and Emma Cummings. Randy was a wonderful husband, loving and proud father, son, great brother and friend, and was dedicated to his family. His favorite pasttimes were hunting, golfing and spending time with his three girls. He will be greatly missed. He is survived by his wife of 16 years, Kelly Crocker Beckham; daughters, Emily Kaye Beckham and Randi Lynn Beckham; mother, Nore Land and husband Norman; father, Randy Beckham Sr. and wife Vera Rose; sister, Jennifer Bridges and husband Lucas; brothers; Billy Beckham and wife Tracie, Jimmy Beckham and wife Hannah; mother and father-in-law, Bob and Gloria Crocker; sisters-in-law, Kim Thomas and husband Mitch, Kristy Barton and husband Chris, and Angel Strickland Beckham; nieces, Haley Beckham, Chloe Beckham, Madison Beckham, Caroline Thomas, Abbey Barton and Allie Barton; nephews, Cody Beckham and Drew Thomas; special friends, Trey and Kelli Green and Greg and Crystie Oden. Pallbearers will be Billy Beckham, Jimmy Beckham, Cody Beckham, Lucas Bridges, Chris Barton, Mitch Thomas, Trey Green and Greg Oden. Visitation will be held Thursday from 5:00 PM until 8:00 PM at Kilpatrick Funeral Home West Monroe. Online condolences may be sent to the family at www.kilpatrickfuneralhomes.com. Kilpatrick Funeral Home West Monroe, LA. Published in The News Star on June 2, 2011

Dora Alwell Charrier Dora Charrier, 86, of Monroe, and formerly of Chalmette, passed away on May 31, 2011 at the Northeast LA War Veterans Home. Dora, a devoted wife and loving mother, was an expert seamstress, superb cook and licensed cosmetologist. She owned and operated a beauty salon for 30 years before retirement. Dora had the distinction of being the first veteran's spouse to be admitted to the Northeast LA War Veterans Home where she spent three weeks with her husband of 67 years, Horace, before his passing in March, 2011. Survivors include a son, H. David Charrier, Jr. of Philadelphia, PA; a brother, Albert Alwell of Deville, LA; special grand nieces, Paulette Cappel and Cindy Dwyer, both of Monroe; as well as, Robyn Dewhirst of New Orleans; and numerous nieces, nephews, grand nieces, and grand nephews. The family would like to thank Antonia "Toni" Gordon and the staffs of the Northeast LA War Veterans Home and Cornerstone Hospital for their caring and devoted service. A Memorial Service will be held at the First Baptist Church of Chalmette at 10:30 AM on Saturday, June 25th, with Dr. John Dee Jefferies presiding. Visitation will be at 9:30 AM until service time. Memorials may be made to the First Baptist Church of Chalmette, 305 E Saint Bernard Hwy, Chalmette, LA 70043-5163 Online Registry/Condolences: www.mulhearnfuneralhome.com Mulhearn Funeral Home Sterlington Road Monroe, LA Published in The News Star on June 2, 2011

Sandra Mitchell Eby Funeral services for Sandra Mitchell Eby, 65, of Monroe, will be held at 10:00 AM Friday, June 3, 2011, at Grace Episcopal Church with The Reverend Bill Easterling, The Reverend Ned Head, and The Reverend Paula Claire Hall officiating. Interment will follow at Mulhearn Memorial Park Cemetery under the direction of Mulhearn Funeral Home, Sterlington Road, Monroe. Mrs. Eby died May 31, 2011 after a long courageous battle with cancer. Sandra was born in Shreveport, LA and graduated from Byrd High School in 1963 where she was a top tennis player in the state. She graduated from Louisiana Tech University where she was a member of Kappa Delta sorority receiving a bachelor's degree in education in 1967. She married John Christian Eby, Jr. on August 12, 1967, and they resided in Texas before moving back to his hometown of Monroe, LA in 1979 with their children, Wesley and Christian. Sandra worked alongside her husband at the family business, raised her children, and was active in the Monroe Junior League as well as St. Alban's Episcopal Church, serving as secretary, acolyte director, and a member of the vestry. She also enjoyed house-boating on the Ouachita River. She was preceded in death by her mother, Edna Nabours Mitchell, and her father, David Mitchell. Survivors include her husband, John Christian Eby, Jr.; son, John Christian Eby III; daughter, Wesley Eby Johnson and her husband Bruce; sisters, Sara Upton and husband Randy of Lafayette, LA, and Suzanne Heath and husband Harold of Lake Charles, LA; mother-in-law, June Eby; grandchildren, Emma Jane, Helen, and Keith Johnson; sisters-in-law, Lynda McGehee and husband Harry, and Leah Stewart and husband Glenn; and numerous nieces and nephews. Pallbearers will be Dr. Don Marx, Harold Heath, Randy Upton, John Cutler, Glenn Stewart, and Harry McGehee. Visitation will be Thursday from 7:00 PM until 9:00 PM at St. Alban's Episcopal Church. Sandra and her family were supported by a host of special friends over the years and express their gratitude to them as well as to her doctors and many caregivers both at home and at the Landmark Nursing Home. Memorials may be made to St. Alban's Episcopal Church, Grace Episcopal Church, or to the charity of your choice. Online Registry/Condolences: www.mulhearnfuneralhome.com Mulhearn Funeral Home Sterlington Rd., Monroe, LA. Published in The News Star on June 2, 2011

Ray Edward Hebert Funeral Services celebrating the life of Ray Edward Hebert, 80, of West Monroe, LA will be held 11:00 AM Friday June 3, 2011 at the McGuire United Methodist Church in West Monroe, LA with Rev. Michi Head, Rev. Chris McLain and Rev. David Dietzel officiating. Interment will be in Hebert Cemetery in Hebert, LA. under the direction of Mulhearn Funeral Home, West Monroe. Ray died peacefully at his home with his wife by his side on May 30, 2011. Ray was a faithful member of the McGuire United Methodist Church, where he served in numerous positions. He strived to share his Christian faith and sweet spirit with anyone he came in contact with. Graduating from Columbia High School, he began his first employment with Brown Paper Mill, later with Missouri Pacific Railroad. In 1955, Ray began his career with the United States Postal Service retiring after 35 years of service. One year after his retirement, he joined the postal staff at ULM until his retirement once again in 2010. In earlier years, he was very active in West Monroe Dixie Youth Baseball, as a coach and as a member of the Executive Board. He enjoyed seeing the young men he coached become outstanding men in our community. Ray was very dedicated for many years in his masonry work. He was a Master Mason and 32nd degree Scottish Rite Mason; he served as Worshipful Master of the J. C. Stewart Lodge, Columbia Lodge and was an honorary member of the West Monroe #419 Lodge for his years of service. In 1949, Ray married Lydia Louise Woodruff and enjoyed their life together with their three son's until "Katie's" death in 1983. In June of 1984, Ray and Kathie Waller Kees began their blended family with Ray's sons and Kathie's daughter and son; they were blessed with 26 years of marriage. He is preceded in death by his parents, Henry L. and Lillie B. Hebert; brothers, H. Morell Hebert, James L. Hebert, and O. C. Hebert, sister, Annie Mildred Hebert, and his son, Henry William Hebert. Survivors include his wife, Kathie Waller Kees Hebert, children, Ray E. Hebert, Jr. and wife, Rubette, Mark D. Hebert, Kristie Kees McGee and husband, Greg, and Joel M. Kees and wife, Jessica; Grandchildren, Michelle Hebert Counts and husband, Mark, Justin Ray Hebert and wife, Jen, Matthew David Hebert, Kaleb Eugene McGee, Kenzie Rose McGee, Lily Lynn Kees; Great-Grandchildren, Jed Alan Counts, Olivia Grace Counts, Daxton Grey Counts; Sister, Mrs. Eloise Hebert Shields, and numerous nieces and nephews and his dearest friends, C. B. "Buddy" and Jean Griggs. Pallbearers will be Mike Shields, Fred Shields, Dale Shields, Alan Shields, Chad Shields and Andrew Shields. Visitation will be held from 5:00 PM until 8:00 PM Thursday at Mulhearn Funeral Home in West Monroe. Memorials may be made to the McGuire United Methodist Church Building Fund, Cystic Fibrosis Foundation or the charity of your choice. Online Registry/Condolences: www.mulhearnfuneralhome.com Mulhearn Funeral Home West Monroe, LA. Published in The News Star on June 2, 2011

Capt. William N. "Buck" Lay William Norman "Buck" Lay, 74, passed away on May 30, 2011. Buck was born in Caldwell Parish, LA, on January 12, 1937, the son of Hardy and Pearl (Humphreys) Lay. He was raised in Columbia, LA, and was graduated from Grayson High School in 1955. He served in the U.S. Army for three years. On March 24, 1962, he married Helen F. Baugh. They left Columbia in 1973 and began a series of job-related moves within the river industry. Buck had started as a deckhand in 1958 and progressed to captain. He then held several shoreside positions including V.P. of Operations in two barge companies. In 1985, he and Helen settled in Paducah, KY, where together they started B & H Towing Co., Inc. and operated the company for 23 years. In Paducah, Buck was a dedicated member of Immanuel Baptist Church where he served in many ways including as a deacon, chair of the Future Development Committee, and participant in a variety of mission activities including numerous trips to Klintsy, Russia. He also served his community in a variety of civic roles that included active involvement with the River Discovery Center and the United Way. He will be remembered for his strong Christian faith, his love of and devotion to family and friends, his strengths in leadership and mentoring, and his service and generosity to others. He was preceded in death by his parents, his wife, his sister Lynette Lay, and his nephew Larry Steele. Buck is survived by his four children and eight grandchildren: Keith (Melissa) Lay of Paducah and their children Ashley, Caleb, and Matthew; Phyllis Boyd of Paducah and her children Cody and Andi; Cindy (John) Harter of Richmond, KY, and their children Mary and William; and Celeste (Chris Fettweis) Lay of New Orleans, LA, and their daughter Lucy. Also surviving are one sister, Nelda May, of Columbia, LA, and numerous nieces and nephews and their families. Funeral services will be held in Paducah on Thursday, June 2, 2011, at 11:00 AM at Immanuel Baptist Church, with Rev. Jamie Broome officiating. Friends may call at Milner and Orr from 5:00 PM - 8:00 PM on Wednesday, June 1, 2011. Visitation will resume in the parlor at Immanuel Baptist Church on Thursday, June 2, 2011, at 10:00 AM. The body will be transported to Louisiana for burial at Palestine Baptist Church Cemetery, Caldwell Parish. Visitation will be held at Palestine on Saturday, June 4, 2011, at 9:30 AM - 11:30 AM, and a graveside service will be held there on Saturday at Noon. Memorial contributions may be made to the Immanuel Baptist Church Building and Grounds Buck Lay Memorial Fund, 3465 Buckner Lane, Paducah, KY 42001; or, to the River Discovery Center, 117 S. Water St., Paducah, KY 42001. You may leave a message of sympathy or light a memorial candle at www.milnerandorr.com Kilpatrick Funeral Home West Monroe, LA Published in The News Star on June 2, 2011

John R. McCartney Funeral services for Mr. John R. McCartney, 84, of Sterlington will be held at 1:00PM Friday, June 3, 2011 at Paron Baptist Church, Sterlington with Bro. Kurt Auger, Terry Gainey and Jarod Hawthorn officiating. A graveside service and burial will follow at 3:30pm at Crowville Masonic Cemetery near Delhi, LA. Arrangements are under the direction of Farrar Funeral Home in Farmerville. Mr. McCartney, a retiree from the Thermatomic Carbon Plant in Sterlington died May 31, 2011. He was a faithful member of Paron Baptist Church which he dearly loved. His also enjoyed gardening, fishing and music. Left to cherish his memory are his wife of 38 years, Emily "Tom" McCartney; 4 daughters: Mary Ann Johnson, Peggy Cupp & husband, Harold, Betty Lou Johnson & husband, Emmett and Nell Ambrose & husband, Bobby; 7 grandchildren: John Michael Johnson, Kerry Glynn Thompson, Randell Cruse, Eve Tomleonivch, Jay Johnson, Lori Sturdivant and Brant Cupp; 8 great grandchildren and a host of nieces, nephews, other relatives and his best friend, Milo. Pallbearers are Randell Cruse, Mike Benson, Bobby Ambrose, "Little Bit" Baker, Lee Johnson and Marvin Simpson. Honorary pallbearers are Carlton Weeks, L.C. Littlefield and Buddy Hollis. Visitation will at Paron Baptist Church on Thursday, June 2nd from 5:00-8:00pm. Online condolences may be sent to the family at www.farrarfh.com Farrar Funeral Home Farmerville, LA Published in The News Star on June 2, 2011

Larry E. "Joe" Reeves Funeral services for Larry E. "Joe" Reeves, 71 of West Monroe will be held at 11:00 AM, Friday, June 3, 2011 at Ridge Avenue Baptist Church. Rev. David Brown will be officiating. Interment will follow at St. Paschal's Cemetery, West Monroe under the direction of Kilpatrick Funeral Home West Monroe. Mr. Reeves was born October 22, 1939 in Monroe, LA and passed away May 31, 2011 in West Monroe. He retired from Manville with over 25 years of service and was former owner of Reflections in West Monroe. He was preceded in death by his mother, Ellen Reeves, father, Harry Hartley and, step-father, Irving Reeves and step-son, Eddie Foreman. Mr. Reeves is survived by his wife of 38 years; Jimmie Sue Rains Reeves; daughter, Janna Fracht; step-daughter, Debbie Bennett and husband David; grandchildren; Matthew Fracht, James Fracht, Brian Feeback and wife Jessica, Laura Gasca and husband Carlos; great-grandchildren; Anthony Gasca, Savannah Feeback, Lauren Gasca, Jesse Brian Feeback; sister, Virginia Reeves; brothers, Floyd Reeves, Harry "Skip" Hartley; sister-in-law, Janet Corbin; a special aunt, Melda Silk. In lieu of flowers memorials may be made to Louisiana Baptist Children's Home. A special thanks to Dr. Herschel Harter and Dr. Lowrey Thompson for the special care they gave Joe during his illness. Visitation will be Thursday, June 2, 2011 from 5:00 PM until 8:00 PM at Kilpatrick Funeral Home West Monroe. Online condolences may be sent to the family at www.kilpatrickfuneralhomes.com Kilpatrick Funeral Home West Monroe, LA. Published in The News Star on June 2, 2011

Imogene Branch Tarver Imogene Branch Tarver passed peacefully from this life at home on June 3, 2011 after a brief illness. She had a full life, well lived, was spiritually prepared, and was a beautiful lady. Jean was born in Walters, Oklahoma on December 26, 1919. After having enlisted in the U.S. Women's Army Corps to help hasten the return of her brothers and our troops in WWII, she attained the rank of Staff Sergeant in a unit decoding enemy messages, something of which she was hesitant to speak. While serving two and one-half years in the service of her country, she met her future husband Willis A. Tarver and they married after the war. The young couple both attended the University of Denver where Jean received a degree in education. She also attained a Masters degree from Colorado State University. Jean and Willis settled in Adams County, Colorado as educators where she enjoyed a career teaching business education. Upon retirement, they returned to Caldwell Parish and Columbia and became active in civic, cultural, and social organizations. She was a tireless fundraiser. Jean was deeply honored to have been recognized as a 50- year member of her beloved Order of the Eastern Star. She dearly loved to open her home to many local church and civic organizations and was known as a gracious hostess. Jean was preceded in death by her husband of 52 years, Willis A. Tarver. She is survived by her son, Willis A. "Tarby" Tarver II and wife Mimi Hunnicutt Tarver; a granddaughter, Katherine Tarver, whom she adored and doted upon; sister, Katherine Robles and brother, Joe Branch; niece, Regina Franklin; nephew, Jimmie Lee Grant; her friend, Dennis Mullican, whom she referred to her as her "good" son; and Robert Collinson, her dedicated caretaker and devoted friend. Visitation will be from 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM Saturday June 4, 2011 at Riser Funeral Home in Columbia. Burial services will be held privately at Welcome Home Cemetery in Grayson. The Tarver family requests that in lieu of flowers or food, planned memorials be made to the Caldwell Parish Public Library. Riser Funeral Home Columbia, LA. Published in The News Star on June 4, 2011

Born to William Edward and Nancy Haley Trammell Miller on November 4, 1921, in Marthaville, LA, Mary Ellen grew up in the Cedar Grove area of Shreveport. She attended Atkins Elementary School and C. E. Byrd High School. As an adult, she enrolled in nursing school and posted the top grade in the state on her board examinations. After a long nursing career with Our Lady of the Lake Hospital in Baton Rouge, Highland Hospital in Shreveport, the U. S. Army Hospital at Ft. Polk in Leesville, and the Veterans Administration Hospital in Shreveport, she retired in 1986. She has lived in Baton Rouge, Anacoco and Longstreet, but most recently divided her time between Monroe and Grand Junction. She was a member of St. Mark's United Methodist Church in Monroe. Mary was devoted to family and especially enjoyed her grandchildren and great grandchildren. She lived her life unselfishly, always putting the needs and wants of others first. An accomplished cook, she enjoyed preparing favorite dishes for family and friends throughout her life. Her hospitality is legendary. She enjoyed reading and travel and keeping up with current events. Mary is preceded in death by Lester A. Weeks, her husband of over 50 years; James Burroughs, her second husband of 10 years; sisters Sybil T. Groves and Tessie L. Martin, and granddaughter Mary Weeks Ayala. Survivors include sister Ruby Miller Minton of Tyler, TX; son William E. Weeks Sr. and wife Bobbie of Monroe and daughter, Jean Tally and husband Richard of Grand Junction, CO. Grandchildren include William E. Weeks Jr. and wife Ramona of Monroe; Michelle Blount and husband Jonathan of Granbury, TX; Gregory S. Tally and wife Meredith of Littleton, CO, and Anne E. Tally of Highlands Ranch, CO. Beloved great grand children are Daila and Trey Weeks; Jordan, Micah and Joshua Blount, and Caroline and Joseph Tally. Numerous nieces, nephews and other relatives and friends in Louisiana, Texas, Mississippi, Colorado and Washington state also mourn her passing. Rev. McKee Williams will conduct the service. Pallbearers include William E. Weeks Jr., Gregory Tally, Dean Thompson and Richard Tally. The family is especially grateful to the staff at the Hospice and Palliative Care of Western Colorado in Grand Junction, who gave her such skillful, loving care, and encourages anyone wishing to remember Mary to donate to Hospice to help them continue their ministry to patients and families. Rose-Neath Funeral Home Shreveport, LA Published in The News Star on June 5, 2011

James L. Liner Funeral Services for James Lea Liner, age 68, of West Monroe, LA, will be 10:00AM Monday, June 6, 2011, at Family Church in West Monroe, LA, with Rev. Terry Mims officiating. Interment will follow, with military honors at Kilpatrick Serenity Garden, under the direction of Mulhearn Funeral Home in West Monroe. The family will receive friends for visitation from 4:30PM until 8:30PM Sunday, June 5, 2011, at Mulhearn Funeral Home. Mr. Liner was born September 16, 1942, in Monroe, LA, and died Wednesday, June 1, 2011, while canoeing the Buffalo River near Harrison, AR. He was an active part of this community. Mr. Liner was ordained to preach the Gospel by First Baptist Church of West Monroe and served on the staff of several local churches filling the role of youth minister, music minister and interim pastor. He was an Art teacher at West Monroe High School and Driver's Education instructor for Ouachita Parish School Board. Mr. Liner also worked with Ouachita Counseling Center. Other community involvement included serving on the Ouachita Valley Federal Credit Union Board of Directors, Republican Parish Executive Committee, Twin City Optimist Club, West Monroe Jaycees, Youth theatre program, and the Donnie Driscoll Foundation. Mr. Liner was a veteran of the United States Air Force where he served as Chaplin's Assistant, receiving the Air Force Commendation Medal and Vietnam Campaign Ribbon in 1969. James Liner was a man who lived out his faith in the Lord Jesus Christ. His life has influenced many people as he has been salt and light to this community. He will be greatly missed. Mr. Liner was preceded in death by his parents, Roylea Jeb Liner and Mamie Frances Crawford Liner. Family members left to cherish his memory are his brother Stanley Dale Liner, Sr. and his wife, Sharon of West Monroe; sisters Nellie Sue Liner Guidry of Harrisburg, NC, and Claudia Jean Liner Wright and her husband Rusty of Hernando, MS; children Michael Shawn Liner and his wife Marja of Baton Rouge; James Edward Williams and his wife Jamie of Downsville, LA; Jason Williams of West Monroe; Jessica Ward and her husband, Steven of West Monroe; Samantha Welch and her husband, Randy of West Monroe; Gary Isaiah Odom of West Monroe; and Christopher Liner; grandchildren Maggie, Mason, Crystal, Garrett, Brad, McKenzie, Alexis, Isaiah, Uriah, Katheryn, Ruby, Jade, Cheyenne, Jasmine, Gabrielle, Nevaeh, Isabella-Lea, Alisa, Ethan and Veronica; numerous nephews and nieces; and the many students he has enjoyed teaching over the years. Pallbearers will be Ronald Crawford, Charles Joe Gaston, Steven Ward, Rusty Wright, Charles Many, Clifton Liner, James Williams, Jason Carter. Walter H. Pipes Walter H. Pipes died Saturday, June 4, 2011, after a long battle with Alzheimer's. He was born May 20, 1921, near Downsville, LA, and was residing at the War Veterans Home in Monroe, LA. Walter was a graduate of Choudrant High School, attended Louisiana Tech, and was a member of the Louisiana Tech Boxing Team. On October 20, 1940, he entered the U. S. Marine Corp. During World War II, he served in the South Pacific as a Sergeant with the 8th Marines, Second Division. He fought and was injured in the Battle of Guadalcanal. From there, he was sent to New Zealand to recover from severe malaria and battle fatigue. Upon returning to the United States, he received a Honorable Discharge in November 1945. He married Elizabeth (Betty) Didier and was employed by Pacific Bell Co. in California. After retirement from Pacific Bell, he worked for the Angeles Baseball Team in the Security and Parking System. In 1997, he and Betty moved to Ruston, LA. Walter was preceded in death by his wife, Betty; parents, Wade H. (Tobe) and Eliza Allen Pipes; sister, Doris; and brother, Truman. Mr. Pipes is survived by his sister, Mary Glynn Winham; brother, Bert Pipes; and numerous nieces and nephews. Military graveside services will be 9:30 AM Monday, June 6, 2011, at the Longstraw Cemetery in Choudrant, LA. Visitation will be immediately following the service. The family request remembrances are made in his honor to the U. S. Marine Corps Heritage Foundation, P. O. Box 998, Quantico, VA 22134-0996; Louisiana Military Museum, 201Memorial Drive Ruston, LA 71270; or Longstraw Cemetery Fund, 199 Mosswood Road, Choudrant, LA 71227. Online condolences may be sent to the family at www.kilpatrickfuneralhomes.com Kilpatrick Funeral Home Ruston, LA Published in The News Star on June 5, 2011

Daryle Scott Bernice Funeral services for Daryle Scott Bernice, age 53, will be 10:00 AM Friday, June 10, 2011 at Griffin Funeral Home in West Monroe with Cheryl Roach officiating. Internment will follow at Hasley Cemetery in West Monroe. Daryle was born October 15, 1957 in Monroe, Louisiana and died June 4, 2011 in West Monroe, Louisiana after a short, but valiant battle with cancer. Daryle lived most of his life in and around the Twin Cities but also called South Louisiana and Texas home for a number of years. Daryle loved his family and friends above all else and was well loved by many. Everyone who knew Daryle will remember his humor and energy and his sweet and generous spirit. Daryle was a loyal Saints fan, even when the team was known as the Aints and the paper bag custom began. He loved watching all football and followed the game on and off season closely. He was widely known as an excellent cook and loved to eat good food. Daryle was a wonderful host and cherished opportunities to bring his loved ones together to eat and visit. He appreciated music of all kinds and enjoyed fishing. Daryle worked in a variety of occupations over the years within the oil and gas pipeline industry, HVAC service, and in asbestos abatement. Daryle will be missed deeply by his many friends and loved ones. He is survived by his wife Kathy Watson Bernice and children Nicholas Bernice, Sarah Navarro Cash and husband Mike, Shane Green and wife Sunny, Holly Green, Scotty Bernice, Nikki Bernice, Mallory Bernice, and Logan Bernice; parents Carolyn and Ron Holt and Gordon Bernice Sr.; one brother Gordon "Sonny" Bernice, Jr and wife Mary; one sister, Joylyn Bernice Humphrey and husband Dan; 5 grandchildren; and numerous nieces and nephews. The Pallbearers will be Micah Bernice, Mike Cash, Dan Humphrey, Heath Kuhn, Chris (Lump) Johnson, Peter Watson, and Al Mouton. Honorary Pallbearers will be Vic Barton and Malcolm Martin. Visitation will be Thursday, June 9, 2011 from 4:00 PM until 7:00 PM at Griffin Funeral Home in West Monroe. Memorials may be made to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital . On line condolences may be made to the family at www.griffin-funeralhome.com. Griffin Funeral Home West Monroe, LA. Published in The News Star on June 8, 2011

Danny Hawthorne officiating. Interment will follow at Crowville Masonic Cemetery under the direction of Mulhearn Funeral Home, Sterlington Road, Monroe. Sigal Marie Burdine Bond Kavanaugh Ory Services for Sigal Marie Burdine Bond Kavanaugh Ory, age 88, of Ruston will be held Thursday June 9, 2011 at 11:00 AM at Kilpatrick Funeral Home in Ruston. Officiating the service will be Rev. Jim Benbrook. Interment will follow at Greenwood Cemetery under the direction of Kilpatrick Funeral Home.Born September 14, 1922 in Springhill, LA. and died June 6, 2011 in Ruston, LA. She was preceded in death by the father of her children, Newton H. Kavanaugh and her second husband, Paul Richard Ory. Sigal attended Hillcrest Elementary and A.E. Phillips High School where she met her future sister-in-law, Linda Kavanaugh Rolf. Sigal was a member of Grace United Methodist Church in Ruston. Sigal operated the general store she and Newt owned in Clay until she learned the florist trade under the tutelage of Louise Carter. She worked at The Flower Shop in Monroe and at Bessie's in Ruston until she purchased that shop. Later she moved to the Baton Rouge area and worked for the LA. Tourist Commission. There she made contacts that led her to Madewood, Laura, and finally Oak Alley Plantation where she worked as a hostess/assistant and met Paul Ory, retired farm manager. She also worked for the LA. Dept of Corrections in St Gabriel supervising trustee inmates landscaping the grounds. Sigal never met a stranger and opened her heart, home, and table to all. She loved people and doing things with unbelievable talents for all kinds of projects. When she returned to Ruston, she worked for the City in landscaping/green thumb area and may be remembered for digging in the dirt. She is survived by her daughter, Lou Taylor of Ruston, her son, Track Kavanaugh and his wife, Faye of Ruston and her son, John Raymond Kavanaugh also of Ruston, granddaughter, Mary Lou K. Oswalt and her husband Brian and great granddaughter, Trystyn; grandson, John Kavanaugh and wife, Rebecca and great granddaughter, Hannah and great grandson Ethan, as well as granddaughter, Christen Kavanaugh. Pallbearers will be Jerry Grigsby, Richard Howell, Ricky Christian, Phil Gordon, Gary Bullock, and Jay Kavanaugh. Memorials may be made to LA Tech University Foundation, Dept. of Ag Science, Horticulture Division, P.O Box 3183, Ruston, LA 71272. Visitation will be held from 9:30 AM to 11:00 AM, Thursday, June 9, 2011 at Kilpatrick Funeral Home in Ruston. Online condolences may be sent to the family at www.kilpatrickfuneralhomes.com Kilpatrick Funeral Home Ruston, LA Published in The News Star on June 8, 2011
